citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
On review of observation records of hoofstock that recently underwent disposition at the facility, it was found that a female
sable antelope's ("Limpopo") health status and behavior was not communicated with the attending veterinarian in a timely
manner. Her facility records indicate a change in feeding behavior that was first noted on 4 January 2023 and continued
until first attempted contact with the attending veterinarian on 26 January 2023; a duration of three weeks. During this
time, the animal was not seen coming up with the herd for twice a day feeding and at times not moving from a laying
position all day. Staff record bringing food to her, forcing her to stand and assessments that she "looks okay". The animal
received veterinary care on 31 January 2023 and showed improvement until 8 February 2023 when she was noticed not
eating that day. On 13 February 2023, the facility noted the animal looking very bloated. The facility received and carried
out treatment orders from the attending veterinarian until the animal was found deceased on 16 February 2023. Delaying
reports of changes in health or behavior status to the attending veterinarian can result in prolonged discomfort, illness or
death to the animal. A mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate
information on problems of animal health, behavior and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
Correct from this date forward of 17 April 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
On review of observation records of hoofstock that recently underwent disposition at the facility, it was found that a female 
sable antelope's ("Limpopo") health status and behavior was not communicated with the attending veterinarian in a timely 
manner.  Her facility records indicate a change in feeding behavior that was first noted on 4 January 2023 and continued 
until first attempted contact with the attending veterinarian on 26 January 2023; a duration of three weeks.  During this 
time, the animal was not seen coming up with the herd for twice a day feeding and at times not moving from a laying 
position all day. Staff record bringing food to her, forcing her to stand and assessments that she "looks okay".  The animal 
received veterinary care on 31 January 2023 and showed improvement until 8 February 2023 when she was noticed not 
eating that day.  On 13 February 2023, the facility noted the animal looking very bloated.  The facility received and carried 
out treatment orders from the attending veterinarian until the animal was found deceased on 16 February 2023.   Delaying 
reports of changes in health or behavior status to the attending veterinarian can result in prolonged discomfort, illness or 
death to the animal.  A mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate 
information on problems of animal health, behavior and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.  
Correct from this date forward of 17 April 2023.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
 n
